question.title: How to log information indicating that the camel JpaComponent started
question.body:
I am using a camel route defined in xml. The route starts from this step:

<camel:route id="jpaRoute" routePolicyRef="startPolicy">
    <camel:from uri="jpa://?persistenceUnit=po&initialDelay={{query.initialDelay}}&delay={{query.delay}}&nativeQuery=select v.* from APP v&resultClass=App"/>
    <!--  Map -->
    <camel:bean ref="mapper" method="map"/>
    <camel:to uri="direct:routestep2-entry"/>
    <!-- aggregate only to log information when poll finished -->
    <camel:aggregate strategyRef="groupedBodyAggregationStrategy" completionTimeout="2000000">
        <camel:correlationExpression>
            <camel:constant>true</camel:constant>
        </camel:correlationExpression>
        <camel:log message="✅  Finished processing " loggingLevel="INFO" logName="route"/>
    </camel:aggregate>
</camel:route>

What this step does is

  1. fetch all entities from table APP
  2. map them one by one
  3. emitt them one by one to the next step of the route :"routestep2-entry"
  4. after all entities will be processed log a message: "✅ Finished processing"
  5. process waits {{query.delay}} and then repeats again

I would lso like to add a message :

<camel:log message="▶️ Started processing " loggingLevel="INFO" logName="route"/>

which will be logged on the start of the route, either before the SELECT is being done, or just after the SELECT. So the whole output will be like:

▶️ Started processing 
map app 1
map app 2
map app n
✅  Finished processing

I cannot add <camel:log before the <camel:from. And if I add the <camel:log just after <camel:from then this log will be outputed n times instead of only once.

How can I log a message indicating that the jpaRoute has started?
